verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning, and they set out from Shittim. They came to the Jordan, he and all the people of Israel, and they camped there before they crossed over.
verses.comment: The translation keeps place names as in the original; Shittim is used as the location.

verses.text: After three days, the officers went through the camp
verses.comment: A simple rendering of the officers' action, matching the Hebrew structure.

verses.text: and they commanded the people, saying, "When you see the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God being carried by the Levitical priests, then you shall set out from your place and follow it."
verses.comment: Includes 'Levitical priests' for clarity, accurate per Hebrew.

verses.text: But there shall be a distance between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure. Do not come near it, so that you may know the way you must go, for you have not passed this way before."
verses.comment: The measurement 'two thousand cubits' retained for accuracy (equals roughly 3,000 feet).

verses.text: And Joshua said to the people, "Consecrate yourselves, for tomorrow the LORD will do wonders among you."
verses.comment: Reflects the Hebrew 'consecrate,' meaning sanctify or prepare ceremonially.

verses.text: And Joshua spoke to the priests, saying, "Take up the ark of the covenant and go ahead of the people." So they took up the ark of the covenant and went before the people.
verses.comment: Plainly translated, keeping the sequence clear.

verses.text: The LORD said to Joshua, "Today I will begin to exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they may know that, as I was with Moses, so I will be with you."
verses.comment: Retains formal language for 'exalt,' matching the Hebrew verb.

verses.text: "And you shall command the priests who carry the ark of the covenant, saying, 'When you come to the edge of the waters of the Jordan, you shall stand still in the Jordan.'"
verses.comment: The command is rendered directly; 'edge' for literal Hebrew.

verses.text: Joshua said to the people of Israel, "Come here and listen to the words of the LORD your God."
verses.comment: Keeps the imperative 'Come here,' as in the literal text.

verses.text: And Joshua said, "By this you shall know that the living God is among you, and that he will certainly drive out before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites.
verses.comment: All people groups named as in the Hebrew.

verses.text: "Look, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is passing before you into the Jordan."
verses.comment: 'Lord of all the earth' preserved for theological emphasis.

verses.text: "Now therefore, take twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe."
verses.comment: Matches the later instructions for selecting men.

verses.text: "And when the soles of the feet of the priests who carry the ark of the LORD, the Lord of all the earth, rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan will be cut off, flowing down from above, and they will stand in one heap."
So when the people set out from their tents to cross the Jordan, the priests carrying the ark of the covenant went ahead of the people.
verses.comment: Describes the order of procession, as in the original.

verses.text: And as soon as those carrying the ark came to the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who were carrying the ark dipped in the edge of the water (now the Jordan overflows all its banks throughout the time of harvest),
verses.comment: Parenthesis clarifies for modern readers the seasonal flooding, preserved as a note in original.

verses.text: the waters flowing down from above stood and rose up in a heap very far away, at Adam, the city beside Zarethan. And those flowing down toward the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea) were completely cut off. And the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
verses.comment: 'Sea of the Arabah' clarified as 'the Salt Sea' (Dead Sea), faithful to Hebrew.

verses.text: And the priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan, and all Israel crossed over on dry ground, until all the people had finished passing over the Jordan.
verses.comment: Emphasizes 'dry ground' as in the Red Sea crossing; matches Hebrew phrasing.
